intro: Oenothera parodiana, commonly known as the Parodiana evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Oenothera parodiana is also known for its medicinal properties, with its seeds containing essential fatty acids.
